arguments.info: ID list of CVM instances to be attached to the scaling group.
ID of a scaling group.

attributes.info: ID list of CVM instances to be attached to the scaling group.
ID of a scaling group.

arguments.info: Defines the action the AS group should take when the lifecycle hook timeout elapses or if an unexpected failure occurs. The valid values are CONTINUE and ABANDON. The default value is CONTINUE.
Defines the amount of time, in seconds, that can elapse before the lifecycle hook times out. The range is 30 to 3600, and default value is 300.
The name of the lifecycle hook.
The instance state to which you want to attach the lifecycle hook. The valid values are INSTANCE_LAUNCHING and INSTANCE_TERMINATING.
Contains additional information that you want to include any time AS sends a message to the notification target.
For CMQ_QUEUE type, a name of queue must be set.
Target type, which can be CMQ_QUEUE or CMQ_TOPIC.
For CMQ_TOPIC type, a name of topic must be set.
ID of a scaling group.

attributes.info: Defines the action the AS group should take when the lifecycle hook timeout elapses or if an unexpected failure occurs. The valid values are CONTINUE and ABANDON. The default value is CONTINUE.
Defines the amount of time, in seconds, that can elapse before the lifecycle hook times out. The range is 30 to 3600, and default value is 300.
The name of the lifecycle hook.
The instance state to which you want to attach the lifecycle hook. The valid values are INSTANCE_LAUNCHING and INSTANCE_TERMINATING.
Contains additional information that you want to include any time AS sends a message to the notification target.
For CMQ_QUEUE type, a name of queue must be set.
Target type, which can be CMQ_QUEUE or CMQ_TOPIC.
For CMQ_TOPIC type, a name of topic must be set.
ID of a scaling group.

arguments.info: A list of Notification Types that trigger notifications. Acceptable values are SCALE_OUT_FAILED, SCALE_IN_SUCCESSFUL, SCALE_IN_FAILED, REPLACE_UNHEALTHY_INSTANCE_SUCCESSFUL and REPLACE_UNHEALTHY_INSTANCE_FAILED.
A group of user IDs to be notified.
ID of a scaling group.

attributes.info: A list of Notification Types that trigger notifications. Acceptable values are SCALE_OUT_FAILED, SCALE_IN_SUCCESSFUL, SCALE_IN_FAILED, REPLACE_UNHEALTHY_INSTANCE_SUCCESSFUL and REPLACE_UNHEALTHY_INSTANCE_FAILED.
A group of user IDs to be notified.
ID of a scaling group.

arguments.info: Specifies whether the adjustment is an absolute number or a percentage of the current capacity. Available values include CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY, EXACT_CAPACITY and PERCENT_CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY.

Define the number of instances by which to scale.For CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY type or PERCENT_CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY, a positive increment adds to the current capacity and a negative value removes from the current capacity. For EXACT_CAPACITY type, it defines an absolute number of the existing Auto Scaling group size.
Comparison operator, of which valid values can be GREATER_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO, LESS_THAN, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO, EQUAL_TO and NOT_EQUAL_TO.
Retry times (1~10).
Cooldwon time in second. Default is 300.
Name of an indicator, which can be CPU_UTILIZATION, MEM_UTILIZATION, LAN_TRAFFIC_OUT, LAN_TRAFFIC_IN, WAN_TRAFFIC_OUT and WAN_TRAFFIC_IN.
An ID group of users to be notified when an alarm is triggered.
Time period in second, of which valid values can be 60 and 300.
Name of a policy used to define a reaction when an alarm is triggered.
ID of a scaling group.
Statistic types, include AVERAGE, MAXIMUM and MINIMUM. Default is AVERAGE.
Alarm threshold.

attributes.info: Specifies whether the adjustment is an absolute number or a percentage of the current capacity. Available values include CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY, EXACT_CAPACITY and PERCENT_CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY.

Define the number of instances by which to scale.For CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY type or PERCENT_CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY, a positive increment adds to the current capacity and a negative value removes from the current capacity. For EXACT_CAPACITY type, it defines an absolute number of the existing Auto Scaling group size.
Comparison operator, of which valid values can be GREATER_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO, LESS_THAN, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO, EQUAL_TO and NOT_EQUAL_TO.
Retry times (1~10).
Cooldwon time in second. Default is 300.
Name of an indicator, which can be CPU_UTILIZATION, MEM_UTILIZATION, LAN_TRAFFIC_OUT, LAN_TRAFFIC_IN, WAN_TRAFFIC_OUT and WAN_TRAFFIC_IN.
An ID group of users to be notified when an alarm is triggered.
Time period in second, of which valid values can be 60 and 300.
Name of a policy used to define a reaction when an alarm is triggered.
ID of a scaling group.
Statistic types, include AVERAGE, MAXIMUM and MINIMUM. Default is AVERAGE.
Alarm threshold.

arguments.info: Trigger times of periodic snapshot, the available values are 0 to 23. The 0 means 00:00, and so on.
Periodic snapshot is enabled, the available values are [0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]. 0 means Sunday, 1-6 means Monday to Saturday.
Retention days of the snapshot, and the default value is 7.
Name of snapshot policy. The maximum length can not exceed 60 bytes.

attributes.info: Trigger times of periodic snapshot, the available values are 0 to 23. The 0 means 00:00, and so on.

Name of snapshot policy. The maximum length can not exceed 60 bytes.

arguments.info: The canned ACL to apply. Available values include private, public-read, and public-read-write. Defaults to private.
The name of a bucket to use.
Specifies caching behavior along the request/reply chain.For further details，RFC2616 can be referred.
Literal string value to use as the object content, which will be uploaded as UTF-8-encoded text.
Specifies presentational information for the object.
Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type referenced by the Content-Type header field.
A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data.
The ETag generated for the object (an MD5 sum of the object content).
The name of the object once it is in the bucket.
The path to the source file being uploaded to the bucket.
Object storage type, Available values include STANDARD, STANDARD_IA and ARCHIVE.

arguments.info: Backup method. Supported values include: physical - physical backup, and logical - logical backup.

Instance backup time, in the format of "HH:mm-HH:mm". Time setting interval is four hours. Default to "02:00-06:00". The following value can be supported: 02:00\-06:00, 06:00\-10:00, 10:00\-14:00, 14:00\-18:00, 18:00\-22:00, and 22:00\-02:00.
Instance ID to which policies will be applied.
Instance backup retention days. Valid values: [7-730]. And default value is 7.

attributes.info: Backup method. Supported values include: physical - physical backup, and logical - logical backup.

Instance backup time, in the format of "HH:mm-HH:mm". Time setting interval is four hours. Default to "02:00-06:00". The following value can be supported: 02:00\-06:00, 06:00\-10:00, 10:00\-14:00, 14:00\-18:00, 18:00\-22:00, and 22:00\-02:00.
Retention period for binlog in days.
Instance ID to which policies will be applied.
Instance backup retention days. Valid values: [7-730]. And default value is 7.

Instance tags.
Disk size (in GB).
